alert.note: Alert for Brown; Coleman; Runnels; Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 16 at 6:54AM CDT until September 16 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Brown County in west central Texas... Northern Coleman County in west central Texas... Northeastern Runnels County in west central Texas... Southeastern Taylor County in west central Texas... * Until 1000 AM CDT. * At 654 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.75 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Brownwood, Coleman, Santa Anna, Bangs, Lawn, Novice, Silver Valley, Grosvenor, Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, Lake Brownwood, Lake Brownwood State Park, Echo, Lake Coleman, Goldsboro, Thrifty and Ovalo. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM-RD 136 crossing Hords Creek, County Road 482 crossing Jim Ned Creek, County Road 482 crossing South Fork Jim Ned Creek, County Road 485 crossing Indian Creek, Liveoak crossing Hords Creek, County Road 176 crossing east Fork Mukewater Creek, County Road 160 crossing West Fork Clear Creek, crossings along County Road 201, crossings along County Road 195 and crossings along Fire Road 161. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
